label: Description
value: Conventionalized scrollwork vase with buds and leaves at top and bottom. Drop repeating arrangement, and the match at the sides is dropped. Heart shaped motifs alternate with the larger motifs.

label: Provenance
value: Was in the stock of Isabella Barclay, Inc., New York City, for many years.

label: Description
value: Conventionalized vase form with flower clusters, in drop repeating arrangement. Beads with pendants are looped in the intervening spaces. Eleven colors on brown ground.

label: Provenance
value: Was in the stock of Isabella Barclay, Inc., New York City, for many years.

label: Description
value: Portion of a repeating motif. A personnage in Chinese garb is seated on a trellised stand in profile. On the ground, at left, a seated figure. Above to the left is a Chinese summer house. Leafy branches and flowers. Printed in numerous colors on pale gray ground.

label: Description
value: Border at top. A major horizontal rectangle has as its chief motif a vase of roses and other flowers on a high stand. At right and left of this are addorsed fowls. Secondary motif, a vertical rectangle, has lamp on high stand intertwined with foliage and floral arabesque. Printed on brown-red ground.

label: Provenance
value: Was in the stock of Isabella Barclay, Inc., New York City.

label: Description
value: Yellow consoles in the form of winged putti with acanthus bases support a cornice. Alternating with these figures are vertical octagons, green, yellow and red, containing wreaths. Heavy chiaroscuro. "d" and "e" are incomplete repeats.

label: Description
value: Arabesque, with, at top center, a faun's head supporting a basin with grasses and a fountain rising from it. From the faun is suspended a net which hangs above a putto with fishing rod. Printed in blues and reds on pale blue ground.

label: Provenance
value: Was part of the stock of Isabela Barclay, Inc., New York City.

label: Physical description
value: brush and black ink on silk, mounted, and with a gray brocade mat

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson

label: Description
value: Pleated fan. Parchment leaf gilded and painted in gouache showing two boys in a landscape next to a tomb. A painted chain casts a trompe-l’oeil shadow on border. Pierced and carved ivory sticks, gilded and silvered. Rivet is set with a faceted stone

label: Physical description
value: Parchment leaf gilded and painted with gouache, pierced and carved ivory sticks, gilded and silvered, rivet set with a faceted stone

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1953: Mrs. Max Farrand collection; 1953: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Necklace. Gold beads with semi-precious stones, on red silk cord.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Max Farrand; 1953: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Neck chain of gilt metal consisting of numerous links of varying widths attached to one another in complicated but repeated pattern.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Max Farrand; 1953: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Four-lobed square form composed of flat base with slightly out-curved, raised scalloped rim; floor of tray and inner and outer rim decorated overall with conventionalized hammered floral motives.

label: Provenance
value: Bought in Paris, Compagnie des Jndes in 1869; Gift of Mrs. Max Farrand

label: Description
value: Pleated fan. Off-white parchment leaf with scenes drawn in black ink. Obverse: the image probably depicts King Phineas harassed by the harpies with the winged Argonauts aattempting to defend the king from the attack. The gorge is painted with rococo ornament. Reverse: a drawing of Rome indicating points of architectural interest; the reverse gorge is not painted. Incised ivory stick with black paint. Metal at rivet.

label: Physical description
value: Parchment leaf drawn with pen and black ink, incised ivory sticks with black paint; metal rivet

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1953: Mrs. Max Farrand collection; 1953: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Borders of needle lace, Gros Point de Venise, in large floral pattern connected by brides picotées and outlined by cordonnet.

label: Description
value: Pair of cuffs and collar, rose pattern.

label: Description
value: Pleated fan. Parchment leaf painted with gouache in grisaille. Obverse: a large central cartouche showing figures in a landscape with sheep; a small cartouche at left with musical trophy and at right with putto; floral border. Reverse: landscape showing figure and small floral spray. Pierced and carved ivory sticks. Rivet is set with a faceted stone.

label: Physical description
value: Parchment leaf painted with gouache, pierced and carved ivory sticks, rivet set with a faceted stone

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1953: Mrs. Max Farrand collection; 1953: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Linen double lappet of bobbin lace on machine net. At either end large-scale floral pattern and cartouche. Rest of net dotted with fleurs volantes.

label: Description
value: Flounce with a design of huntsmen, birds, animals, and elaborate tree pattern.

value: Medium: linen Technique: bobbin lace, discontinuous tape

label: Description
value: Flounce with a design of huntsmen, birds, animals, and elaborate tree pattern. Pattern pieces connected by large scale four-sided mesh.

value: Medium: linen Technique: bobbin lace, discontinuous tape

label: Description
value: Linen double lapet, needle lace, Point de Gaze. All-over floral clusters and sprays. Elaborate star at both ends of lappet with radiating sections ending in leaves.

value: Medium: linen Technique: needle lace with ground of loop & twist with loop & twist return

label: Description
value: Pair of sleeves crocheted in white linen with a design of roses.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 32 x 13 cm (12 5/8 x 5 1/8 in.) each

label: Description
value: Cylindrical body with high, concave neck, open on top.  Opening covered by ivory button fastened to wire which  goes through the opening.  Pivoting on center axis on bottom three radiating feet ending in ivory knobs. Pivoting cover for opening through which pepper corns are put in. Marked Gorham three marks 'G'.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Max Farrand; 1953: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Brisé fan. Lacquered wood sticks; black ground with figures in landscape, surrounded with borders and other decorative detail exquisitely painted in two tones of gold and minute touches of vermillion. Reversible, so the in one direction, the composition seems to be thrown out of proper relation. Black silk ribbon. Red and green silk tassels. Gilt metal bail.

label: Physical description
value: Lacquered, painted and gilded wood sticks, silk ribbon and tassels, gilt metal bail

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1953: Mrs. Max Farrand collection; 1953: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Pleated fan. Bobbin lace leaf in natural linen color. Pierced ivory sticks piquéd, incised and silvered.

label: Physical description
value: Linen bobbin lace leaf, pierced ivory sticks piquéd, incised and silvered

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1953: Mrs. Max Farrand collection; 1953: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Bangle, gold band, glass "gem" to repel the evil eye.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Max Farrand; 1953: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Long rectangular field with lobed black central medallion with two dealer's marks embroidered in white silk. Great variety of intertwining floral bands and fields and very attenuated curling cones.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool Technique: plain and interlocked twill tapestry; pieced together Label: plain and interlocked wool twill tapestry, pieced together

label: Description
value: Two fronts and two pocket flaps for man's waistcoat, or cream colored linen, plain cloth, embroidered in colored silks in chain stitch. Delicate vine design ascends front. Flower sprays under and on pockets. Colors: red, pink, green, violet, blue, and yellow. Bottom of some cloth, with worked edges. Buttonholes outlined in color, but not cut.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk Technique: embroidery (chain stitch)

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Dolphins, dogs, elephants, and sea-monsters are bing ridden by putti. Inscribed below: "de Bry Excud."

label: Provenance
value: Richard C. Greenleaf; 1953: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: small piee of cream white cotton, block-printed in small detached flowers, about 1-2" long, carntaons, rose, etc., some reversed, some sideways. Colors red, blue, yellow, green and brown for outlines. Right selvage present.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 40 x 28 cm (15 3/4 in. x 11 in.) Repeat H: 22.9 cm (9 in.)

label: Description
value: Panel of light blue silk, intended for a skirt, has an embroidered border in colored silks, metallic thread and sequins, and an appliqué of white net. Design of reversed S-curves supporting a heart-shaped frame with a lion masque at the center. Above frame are flower sprays. Narrow border below worked in gold. Above, in the body of the skirt, are detached flower sprigs in rose, blue and brown with metallic thread.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: sil, metallic thread, sequins Technique: silk embroidery on silk foundation with appliqué

label: Description
value: This is an interior view of a salon with a high ceiling, a doorway on the left and a three-columned alcove at right with a curtained window behind. A large carved settee is placed against the back wall beneath a mirror, extending the full length of the settee, and flanked by military figures on wall brackets; in front of the settee is a table.  A corner etagere in the left rear displays glass and silver objects. A series of low side chairs with high backs are arranged at left and right. The walls are painted sky blue and the floor is of diamond-patterned marble.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor and gouache over graphite on white wove paper
Design for an Icon, Madonna and Child

label: Description
value: Panel of woven silk with a broad yellow satin stripe in the center, flanked by gold-colored satin stripes. Stripes ornamented with small white flowers and geometric strapwork. Central cartouche composed of green leaves on top and a floral garland with ribbons below. Enclosed is a Chinoiserie scene of a seated astronomer with a globe and map accompanied by a youth with telescope.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: satin weave with discontinuous supplementary weft floats (brocade), twill fields

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1953: Christopher Norris  collection; 1953: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Ivory-colored silk with a monochrome pattern of S-meanders and stylized floral sprigs.
Study for "Isle of Capri: The Faraglioni"

label: Description
value: View of the rocky coast and sea with large rocks in lower left foreground leading to larger outcroppings. A rowboat, at center, containing three figures, moves shoreward, where boats beach near dwellings, at center left  of middleground.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and wash, graphite on wove paper
